oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. Ann's Episcopal Church, 2001 March
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of St. Ann's Episcopal Church located at 419 Woodland Street in Nashville, Tennessee. The original historic 1880's era Victorian building was destroyed in a tornado in 1998, but the new building was built on the same site as the old on the corner of Woodland and Fifth Street in the East Nashville neighborhood. The architecture style is modern. The foundation is concrete. The exterior walls are brick. The windows are heavy glass. The doors are made of glass and wood. Special features include stained glass in some windows. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: St. Ann's Episcopal Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
